00026 #define kLOGENV "TWAINDSM_LOG"
00027 
00034 #define kLOGMODEENV "TWAINDSM_LOGMODE"
00035 
00040 #define TWNDSM_MAX_MSG 1024
00041 
00042 
00043 
00047 class CTwnDsmLogImpl
00048 {
00049   public:
00051     CTwnDsmLogImpl()
00052   {
00053     memset(&pod,0,sizeof(pod));
00054   }
00055 
00056   public:
00057     // If you add a class in future, (and I can't imagine why you
00058   // would) declare it here and not in the pod, or the memset
00059   // we do in the constructor will ruin your day...
00060 
00065     struct _pod
00066   {
00067       FILE *m_plog;         
00068       char *m_message;        
00069     char m_logpath[FILENAME_MAX]; 
00070     char m_logmode[16];     
00071   } pod;
00072 };
00073 
00074 
00075 
00086 CTwnDsmLog::CTwnDsmLog(void)
00087 {
00088   // Init stuff...
00089   m_ptwndsmlogimpl = new CTwnDsmLogImpl;
00090 
00091   // see if a logfile is to be used
00092   SGETENV(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logpath,NCHARS(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logpath),kLOGENV);
00093 
00094   // If we have a path, then get our mode...
00095   if (m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logpath[0])
00096   {
00097     SGETENV(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logmode,NCHARS(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logmode),kLOGMODEENV);
00098     if (!m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logmode[0])
00099     {
00100       // The default is to wipe the log clean...
00101       SSTRCPY(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logmode,sizeof(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logmode),"w");
00102     }
00103 
00104   // Only bother to allocate a buffer if logging is on...
00105   m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message = (char*)calloc(TWNDSM_MAX_MSG,1);
00106   if (!m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message)
00107   {
00108       kPANIC("Unable to allocate a buffer for logging...");
00109   }
00110   }
00111 }
00112 
00113 
00114 
00119 CTwnDsmLog::~CTwnDsmLog(void)
00120 {
00121   if (m_ptwndsmlogimpl)
00122   {
00123   if (m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_plog)
00124   {
00125     fclose(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_plog);
00126   }
00127   if (m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message)
00128   {
00129     free(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message);
00130   }
00131   delete m_ptwndsmlogimpl;
00132     m_ptwndsmlogimpl = 0;
00133   }
00134 }
00135 
00136 
00137 
00153 void CTwnDsmLog::Log(int  _doassert,
00154            char *_file,
00155            int  _line,
00156            char *_format,
00157            ...)
00158 {
00159   // We've nothing to do, so bail...
00160   if (0 == m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logpath[0])
00161   {
00162     return;
00163   }
00164 
00165   // Okay, now use the stack...
00166   UINT nError;
00167   UINT nChars;
00168   char *message;
00169   char *file;
00170 
00171   // Grab the system error, this can be really useful...
00172   #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
00173     nError = GetLastError();
00174   #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_GNUGPP)
00175     nError = errno;
00176   #else
00177     #error Sorry, we don't recognize this system...
00178   #endif
00179 
00180   // If we have no log yet, try to get one...
00181   if (0 == m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_plog)
00182   {
00183     FOPEN(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_plog,m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logpath,m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logmode);
00184     if (0 == m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_plog)
00185     {
00186       fprintf(stderr,"DSM: Error - logging has been disabled because logfile could not be opened: %s,%s\r\n",m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logpath,m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logmode);
00187       m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_logpath[0] = 0;
00188     }
00189     return;
00190   }
00191 
00192   // Trim the filename down to just the filename, no path...
00193   file = 0;
00194   #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
00195     // Only look for this on Windows...
00196     file = strrchr(_file,'\\');
00197   #endif
00198   if (!file)
00199   {
00200     // If we didn't find a backslash, try a forward slash...
00201   file = strrchr(_file,'/');
00202   }
00203   if (file)
00204   {
00205   // skip the slash...
00206     file = &file[1];
00207   }
00208   else
00209   {
00210     // Couldn't find any slashes...
00211     file = _file;
00212   }
00213   
00214   // Build the message header...
00215   #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
00216     SYSTEMTIME st;
00217     GetLocalTime(&st);
00218   nChars = SNPRINTF(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message,
00219             TWNDSM_MAX_MSG,
00220                       #if (TWNDSM_CMP_VERSION >= 1400)
00221               TWNDSM_MAX_MSG,
00222                       #endif
00223             "[%02d%02d%02d%03d %-8s %4d %5d %p] ",
00224             st.wHour,st.wMinute,st.wSecond,st.wMilliseconds,
00225             file,_line,
00226             nError,
00227             (void*)(UINT_PTR)GETTHREADID());
00228   #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_GNUGPP)
00229     timeval tv;
00230   tm tm;
00231     gettimeofday(&tv,NULL);
00232   tzset();
00233   localtime_r(&tv.tv_sec,&tm);
00234   nChars = SNPRINTF(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message,
00235             TWNDSM_MAX_MSG,
00236             "[%02d%02d%02d%03ld %-8s %4d %5d %p] ",
00237             tm.tm_hour,tm.tm_min,tm.tm_sec,tv.tv_usec / 1000,
00238             file,_line,
00239             nError,
00240             (void*)GETTHREADID());
00241 
00242   #else
00243     #error Sorry, we don't recognize this system...
00244   #endif
00245 
00246   // This is the room remaining in the buffer, with room for a null...
00247   nChars = (TWNDSM_MAX_MSG - nChars) - 1;
00248   message = &m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message[strlen(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message)];
00249 
00250   // Finally, tack on the user portion of the message...
00251   va_list valist;
00252   va_start(valist,_format);
00253   #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP) && (TWNDSM_CMP_VERSION >= 1400)
00254     _vsnprintf_s(message,nChars,nChars,_format,valist);
00255   #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
00256     _vsnprintf(message,nChars,_format,valist);
00257   #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_GNUGPP)
00258     vsnprintf(message,nChars,_format,valist);
00259   #else
00260     #error Sorry, we don't recognize this system...
00261   #endif
00262   va_end(valist);
00263 
00264   // Write the message...
00265   fprintf(m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_plog,"%s\r\n",m_ptwndsmlogimpl->pod.m_message);
00266 
00267   // Do the assert, if asked for...
00268   if (_doassert)
00269   {
00270     assert(0);
00271   }
00272 }
